title: When was George Washington wounded in war? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apparently, never.  During the French & Indian War, as a British officer, Washington was involved in many battles and somehow always managed to emerge unscathed. George Washington in the French and Indian War - Wikipedia It was noted that after the Battle of the Monongahela in 1755, he had several horses shot out from under him, and he had musket holes in his hat, sleeves, and coat. He was also one of the only remaining officers after the battle and therefore assumed command of what was left of the men. Battle of the Monongahela - Wikipedia This was so amazing to the Native Americans (Indians), that they believed he was protected by the Great Spirit, and could NEVER be harmed or killed in Battle. Indian chief predicts Washington's presidency The "Indian Prophecy"

No physical wounds but it must be assumed that he was shocked and disappointed by the first actions after the issuance of the Declaration of Independence. The Battle of Long Island (or Brooklyn or Brooklyn Heights) proved to be a stunning British victory which was close to leading to the annihilation or capture of the first Colonial army. People throughout history who have achieved great acclaim normally have serious and often overly sensitive personalities. It’s safe to say that George’s ego got wounded. Fortunately he got over it. As did the newly formed United States.
